de.ovgu.swe_projekt.socialdoc

Class Control

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.swe_projekt.socialdoc.Control

  • public class Control
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of the interaction between GUI, user data and external storage.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor; Create new instance of UserData and initialize it.

        Create a new User using the Probandencode entered by the user.

        Write the last alarm time to _userData.

        Write new user times to _userData.
        Parameters:

      • getUserTimes

        public int[] getUserTimes()
        Getter for user times
        Returns:
        user times

      • wasLastQuestionAnswered

        public boolean wasLastQuestionAnswered()
        Check if the last question opened by an alarm has been answered by the user.
        Returns:
        true, if the user answered the last question

      • userAnsweredAQuestion

        public boolean userAnsweredAQuestion()
        Check if the user answered any question yet or if he/she is new.
        Returns:
        true, if the user has answered at least one question since he was created

      • probandenCodeIsEmpty

        public boolean probandenCodeIsEmpty()
        Check if the entry for Probandencode in _userData is empty.
        Returns:
        true, if no Probandencode has been entered by the user yet

      • setNextAlarmAt

        public void setNextAlarmAt(long time)
        Set the time the next alarm will happen at. (see SystemClock.elapsedRealtime())
        Parameters:
        time - time (in milliseconds since system start) the next alarm will happen at

      • isAlarmTime

        public boolean isAlarmTime(long currentTime)
        Check if the current time is an alarm time by comparing it to the next alarm time.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - current system time (SystemClock.elapsedRealtime())
        Returns:
        true, if the current time is close enough to the next alarm time

      • isQuestionInputOK

        public boolean isQuestionInputOK(java.lang.String input)
        Check the user input given for the current question. That means check if this much time can have passed since the last question was answered.
        Parameters:
        input - the user input as taken from the question layout
        Returns:
        true, if the input is a possible amount of time

      • generateQuestionText

        public java.lang.String generateQuestionText()
        Generate the time-specific text to be used in the question.
        Returns:
        String containing the text to be inserted into the question

      • saveUserData

        public void saveUserData()
        Save the user data to the system's preference storage.

      • createCSV

        public boolean createCSV()
        Create the Probandencode.csv if it does not exist yet.
        Returns:
        true, if the file already exists

      • saveUserInputToCSV

        public void saveUserInputToCSV(boolean cancelled,
                      java.lang.String numContacts,
                      java.lang.String numHours,
                      java.lang.String numMinutes)
        Save the user's answer to the current question to the Probandencode.csv. Save dummy-data if the question has been skipped.
        Parameters:
        cancelled - did the user skip answering the question?
        numContacts - amount of contacts the user had since the last question (user input)
        numHours - amount of hours during which the user interacted with contacts since the last question (user input)
        numMinutes - amount of minutes (59 max) during which the user interacted with contacts since the last question (user input)
